items.title: Node system overhaul for better flexibility and usability
items.body:
In order to get features we've wanted for a long time, it became necessary to overhaul the node architecture once again. While I often don't create PRs for my own branches (though I probably should get into the habit), I'm doing so with this because it introduces so many sweeping changes, that it has almost certainly introduced bugs/crashes/incompatibilities that should be resolved before we merge to master. I've also been holding off on making too many changes to `master` since my focus was on this and I wanted to ensure a smooth merge.

The new additions in this branch are:

- Channel swizzling (#1366). All types can be swizzled, including but not limited to floats (float/vec2/3/4), textures (RGBA), and audio (L/R). This allows for much greater flexibility as you can plug single-element values like floats into double-element inputs like position. You can also set which RGBA channels or audio channels a node will affect, and swap them all around at will.
- Value auto-conversion (#1357). Much more comprehensive system to convert between value types. A sine generator (time + math set to sine) can now be plugged into an audio node to produce a tone. 
- Custom value types. Nodes can declare a custom type without having to add a whole new type throughout Olive. This will be useful for nodes that need specific data that can't be provided by out primitives.
- Custom UI. Nodes can provide custom UI widgets for any input. This will greatly ease our ability to make various color grading-specific UIs like curves.
- Math node overhaul and addition of many operations. For too long, this node has only had 5 operations. Now it also has min, max, clamp, floor, ceil, round, and abs. The trigonometry operations have also been merged in.
- General improvements to code, usability, and performance.

Like I said, this is still probably fairly unstable and not everything is complete, but I'm working on getting it up to speed.
